column5: Ok it has been awhile since there was a thread about beer and I am leaving in 5 DAYS!!!!!!!!!!!! And want to try a couple new Canadian Beers. My favorites are Kokanee and Alexander Kieth's IPA. I pre-ordered a bunch of that along with a couple cases of Sleeman's. You Beer Lovers out there give me your suggestions for a couple new ones to try. Have a group of 12 so will have a nice Beer Tasting panel. Thanks
Moose head is my go- to beer here.
I live 1 mile from the Quebec border. Labatt's 50 is my favorite. I'll be stopping at the Duty Free store in four days and loading up for our week at Poutrincourt Outfitters.

I tried the Molson Special Export ale and thought it was outstanding, like a farmer in his field. Very tastee, good texture, not too bitter, good flavor. Didnt see it at the DFA shop, but picked up a few at a quickee mart outside of Montreal. Glad I did.
Spent a week at a fly-in and we had the standard Molsons and labatts Head back for a drive in trip On Friday We will be getting some Steam Whistle and some Molson M Should be good
Creemore is a good small brewery, not available everywhere, though. My favourite is COLD !
Try Big Rock or Fort Garry. Fort Garry is tough to get outside manitoba as it is a winnipeg based beer. My all time favorite beer is Fort Garry Dark, smoothest dark beer I have ever had.
Molson Golden and Molson Export Ale. BOB
Molson's new M. WOW! What a beer! Perhaps the best beer I've ever drank. Other beer near the top of my list are Molson Canadian, Molson Golden, Yuengling Lager, Shiner Bock & Yuengling Premium.
+1 for Labatts 50, I don't drink mutch beer but its a good one. Works good in bear batter too. Labatts ice and maximum ice are favorites also.
